verses.plain: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.

tokens.t: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me
in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.

verses.plain: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? how long will ye love vanity, and seek after leasing? Selah.

tokens.t: O ye sons of men, how long

verses.plain: But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the LORD will hear when I call unto him.

tokens.t: hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the
will hear when I call unto him.

verses.plain: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.

tokens.t: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.

verses.plain: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.

tokens.t: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the

verses.plain: There be many that say, Who will shew us any good? LORD, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.

tokens.t: many that say, Who will shew us
, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.

verses.plain: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased.

tokens.t: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time
their corn and their wine increased.

verses.plain: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, LORD, only makest me dwell in safety.

tokens.t: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou,
, only makest me dwell in safety.

footnotes.text: have…: or, be gracious unto me
